name: Reginald Forthwick
desc: Former head waiter who still arranges place settings.
want: A properly set formal dinner table
backstory: Died mid-service in 1924 correcting a place setting.

name: Agnes Bleecker
desc: Honeymooner who never left; critical of decor.
want: Someone to genuinely acknowledge her
backstory: Checked into Room 7 on her honeymoon in 1943 and never left.

name: Captain Harlan Voss
desc: Former sea captain obsessed with linens.
want: Someone to settle the linen dispute
backstory: Retired sea captain who opened a hotel and died arguing about linens.

name: Miriam Dusk
desc: Jazz singer who still shows up on Fridays.
want: Someone to listen to her perform
backstory: Performed in the lounge every Friday for eleven years.

name: Edmund Pryce
desc: House detective during Prohibition.
want: Acknowledgment that he protected the hotel
backstory: Knew the hotel's secrets and kept them.

name: Nora Fenn
desc: Head housekeeper who never stopped inspecting.
want: The hotel to meet her standards
backstory: Returned to work three days after retirement and never left.

want: Someone to settle the linen dispute
backstory: (see starting)

name: The Boy on Floor 2
desc: A nameless boy heard before seen; rubber ball at odd hours.
want: Someone to acknowledge him without running away
backstory: Called 'the boy on Floor 2' by staff; long-standing presence.

name: Dorothea Vane
desc: Oldest presence, sits in the reading room.
want: To be remembered
backstory: Wife of the original builder; predates the hotel's current name.

name: Cole Parish
desc: Quiet boy who politely greets guests.
want: Someone who is not afraid of him
backstory: Drowned in the hotel pool in 1993 at age eight.

name: Silas Colt
desc: Man who came to disappear and never left.
want: A fair game and someone to call him by his real name
backstory: Arrived in 1882 under a false name and died during a disputed card game.

name: Franklin Beaumont
desc: Bebop pianist who wants the piano kept in tune.
want: Piano kept in tune
backstory: Toured 1947 and stayed considerably longer.

name: Vivienne LaRoche
desc: B-movie actress who hopes to be recognized.
want: To be recognized
backstory: Appeared in drive-in horror films in the late '60s/early '70s.

name: Desmond Flux
desc: Disco DJ who died mid-set.
want: Someone to dance
backstory: Ran the hotel's New Year's Eve parties in the '70s.

name: Jack Morrow
desc: Controversial figure who liked to argue.
want: Someone willing to argue
backstory: Known for long manifestos left around the property.

name: Lady Ashworth
desc: Aristocratic presence concerned with standards.
want: Standards maintained
backstory: Expected propriety and etiquette in every corner of the hotel.

name: Professor Aldous Finch
desc: Scholarly presence who wants field notes preserved.
want: Field notes preserved
backstory: Academic who treated the hotel's records like scripture.

name: Isaiah Crane
desc: Quiet presence who mourns what the water took.
want: Someone to know what the water took
backstory: Connected to an early river-related tragedy.

name: Calvin Dubois
desc: Man connected to Vanport memory.
want: Someone to know Vanport was real
backstory: Wants the memory of Vanport preserved.

name: Thomas Cray
desc: Presence tied to the cellar and old rumors.
want: To know what happened to him
backstory: Associated with a cellar incident in the hotel's early days.
